## R Markdown

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
# Load training data
train <- readRDS("data/train.rds")
dat <- readRDS("data/train.rds")
```

```{r}
ZipGroup <- dat$ZipCode 

mod4 <- lm(AdjSalePrice ~ SqFtTotLiving + BldgGrade + ZipGroup, data = train)

summary(mod4)

```


## Including Plots

Plots for the first model: 

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(data = train, aes(x = SqFtTotLiving, y = AdjSalePrice, group = as.factor(PropertyType)))+
  geom_point(aes(color = as.factor(PropertyType))) + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  labs(title = "Sale price")
```

Outlier Identification 
```{r}
par(mfrow = c(2,2))
plot(mod4)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
